meanings.definition: An instrument that continuously records atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The barograph in the weather station showed the pressure changes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the barograph to track the air pressure over time.
meanings.sent3: The barograph at the museum was so old, it started drawing funny faces instead of pressure readings.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a barograph, always recording every little change in the atmosphere around her.
meanings.sent5: The barograph hummed softly as it diligently recorded the pressure variations.

meanings.definition: To measure and record changes in atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent1: They decided to barograph the pressure trends for the upcoming experiment.
meanings.sent2: He would barograph the data every hour to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The students barographed the air pressure in the classroom, much to the confusion of their teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to barograph every emotion she felt, leaving a trace of each one.
meanings.sent5: The machine whirred as it began to barograph the pressure changes in the room.
